mechanics.condition: Caster targets an unoccupied space they can see within range
mechanics.outcome: A circular portal is conjured, linking the current plane to a different plane of existence

mechanics.condition: Caster chooses a diameter for the portal
mechanics.outcome: The portal's diameter can be made 5 to 20 feet
The portal can be oriented in any chosen direction
The portal lasts for the spell's duration

mechanics.trigger: Attempt to travel through the portal
mechanics.condition: Creature or object attempts to pass through the portal
mechanics.outcome: Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front

mechanics.trigger: Creature or object moves through the portal's front
mechanics.outcome: The creature or object is instantly transported to the other plane, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal

mechanics.condition: A deity or planar ruler is present OR the target location is within their domain
mechanics.outcome: Deities and planar rulers can prevent the portal from opening

mechanics.condition: Caster speaks the specific name of a creature (not a pseudonym, title, or nickname) AND that creature is on a different plane than the caster
mechanics.outcome: The portal opens in the named creature's immediate vicinity

mechanics.condition: Named creature is on a plane other than the caster's
mechanics.outcome: The named creature is drawn through the portal to the nearest unoccupied space on the caster's side of the portal

mechanics.trigger: Creature is summoned via Gate spell
mechanics.condition: Creature has been drawn through the portal
mechanics.outcome: The caster gains no special power over the creature, and it is free to act as the GM deems appropriate

description_text: You conjure a portal linking an unoccupied space you can see within range to a precise location on a different plane of existence. The portal is a circular opening, which you can make 5 to 20 feet in diameter. You can orient the portal in any direction you choose. The portal lasts for the duration. The portal has a front and a back on each plane where it appears. Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front. Anything that does so is instantly transported to the other plane, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal. Deities and other planar rulers can prevent portals created by this spell from opening in their presence or anywhere within their domains. When you cast this spell, you can speak the name of a specific creature (a pseudonym, title, or nickname doesn't work). If that creature is on a plane other than the one you are on, the portal opens in the named creature's immediate vicinity and draws the creature through it to the nearest unoccupied space on your side of the portal. You gain no special power over the creature, and it is free to act as the GM deems appropriate. It might leave, attack you, or help you.
